node.title: Now everyone in WA will have an equal vote, the Nationals are not happy. Here's why
node.alt: The Perth city skyline at dawn.
node.description: Labor's longstanding desire for a one-vote-one-value system is not hard to understand. It will now be easier to get its legislative agenda through Parliament, writes Andrea Mayes.
node.content:
["When the knife-edge 2008 WA election gave the balance of power to the Nationals, the party\u2019s then-leader Brendon Grylls took full advantage.", "During the halcyon days that followed for the Nationals, kingmaker Grylls extracted what many viewed as a king\u2019s ransom for the party\u2019s eventual support of the Barnett government \u2013 the establishment of the Royalties for Regions fund, which automatically allocated 25 per cent of mining royalties to projects in the bush.", "With the state at the peak of a mining boom, the fund proved extremely lucrative, and billions of dollars was diverted to regional communities to fund everything from swimming pools and libraries to dolphin research and mobile phone towers.", "", "
Northam Race Club slashed its annual water bill after Royalties for Regions paid for a dam.(Facebook: Northam Race Club)
", "It\u2019s been a long way down from that zenith to the passing of electoral reform laws overnight to abolish the special weighting country voters have enjoyed.", "Not only has Royalties for Regions since been substantially diluted by being required to fund nearly all regional spending, but now people in the regions don\u2019t get the same\u00a0advantage at the ballot box they\u2019ve been accustomed to.", "No wonder the Nationals are fuming.", "\"What it will do is rip regional representation from this state parliament,\u201d Nationals leader Mia Davies warned in September.", "", "
The Nationals warned before the election that regional areas would\u00a0suffer under Labor.(Facebook: Nationals WA)
", "Yet, the reality is conservative parties were decimated in the WA election to an unprecedented degree.", "
Labor does as it pleases
", "While they are understandably upset at what they see as the government's duplicity in denying electoral reform was on the\u00a0agenda before the election, Labor's unassailable majority means it can do whatever it pleases.", "And with the backing of a committee that found in favour of reforming the upper house, that's precisely what it has done.", "The move has\u00a0also been carefully timed, passed into law as quickly\u00a0as possible in the hope that voters will have forgotten about it by the time the next election rolls around.", "", "
Future WA elections are set to be fought under a revised system.(ABC News: Tabarak Al Jrood)
", "Labor's longstanding desire for a one-vote-one-value system is not hard to understand.", "Before this year's groundbreaking election, which according to ABC election analyst Antony Green was\u00a0probably the biggest landslide in Australian electoral history, Labor had never gained control of the upper house.", "WA's electoral system gave more weight to country voters, who are much more conservatively-minded than their city counterparts, in an attempt to ensure that regional voices were heard in a vast state where 75 per cent of the population lives in Perth.", "", "
An upper house\u00a0vote in country areas like the Goldfields will not be worth the same as before.(ABC Goldfields-Esperance: Jarrod Lucas)
", "It's meant half of all upper house seats have been allocated to\u00a0the 25 per cent of West Australians who don't live in Perth.", "It's also meant that a Legislative Council vote cast\u00a0in the remote outback town of Wiluna had more than six times the weighting of a vote cast in Wanneroo.", "And crucially for Labor, it's meant that prior to its emphatic win in March, every piece of legislation passed through parliament has\u00a0had to be scrutinised and approved by an upper house either dominated by the conservative parties,\u00a0which has mostly been the case, or one where such parties have held the balance of power.", "
More influence but concern in the country
", "In practice, this has meant some pieces of\u00a0legislation considered anathema to conservative values haven't gotten through, while others like voluntary assisted dying have been subjected to significant negotiation.", "No more.", "While the Legislative Council will continue to be the house of review, Labor's suddenly got a much better chance of getting members elected there than it ever has before, landslide or no landslide.", "", "
The changes will fortify Labor's future influence on legislation debated in parliament.(ABC News: Andrew O'Connor)
", "Which of course means it will have a better chance of influencing legislation, even if it's not longer in power.", "In its report, the committee for electoral reform suggested practical steps to ensure adequate regional representation under the new system could include offering upper house members incentives to base their offices in the bush.", "Whether such measures will be enough to allay regional concerns remains to be seen.", "Country voters may indeed find they have to shout louder to be heard."]
